title: Game going smooth then bam, split second ping goes out of control then back to normal
body: So I'll be playing a game of League of Legends like the rest of us, everything is going smooth. Bam, for a couple seconds league will freeze up then go back to normal, like nothing happen. Anyone know how to troubleshoot or fix it? Thank you

replies.body:
Same issue for me. No issues in any other game and this just started happening when i played on monday


http://logsoflag.com/#GKRJ6dX-KOB

Happens with me aswell. For the last 7 days through my router connection game lags for a few seconds to 20 seconds every 5 minutes. Seems to be more of an issue through my router because when i shift to a 4g mobile hotspot connection it seems to stop.

I think maybe it may be a worldwide update on a specific for of firewall software maybe mcafee or norton and permissions are causing issues... dont know though

Are you on Windows 10 and recently updated?  The [Xbox Game Bar](http://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/8637-game-bar-turn-off-windows-10-a.html) has been known to cause freezes after auto-enabling.  Otherwise, give our [FPS issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting) guide a go in case of outdated drivers or bad game files.  Let me know if you have any questions!
I have always had that on. Something I didn't include in the post was, after for a brief second or two my ping will spike to anywhere between 200-400 then go back to my normal 31 ping.

Exact same thing happened to me, down in OCE. The "Attempting to Reconnect" would pop up, if I'm lucky for 2 seconds, if not so lucky for a minute. Frequently in game I'd be issuing commands and the champ would not respond, or fire off the skillshot like 3 seconds later (often in the wrong direction). Very very frustrating to play, and NO IT IS NOT MY CONNECTION. I'm playing at uni (via ethernet too) which has one of the best connections in the country, usually between 6 ~ 22 ms ping.
